results.content: For a short/free course, I thought Patrick was excellent.    My only criticism is that I wish some of the CRUD scenarios were less mocked up (e.g. hard-coded array of objects directly in the code) vs. a more realistic example using a database.   The short EF section at the end was helpful, but I'd prefer these tutorials be more in-line what a developer would really need to do.   All that said, I understand the need to balance course length, complexity, focus (avoiding tangents) and costs to deliver (it was free!!).     All in all great Job Patrick/Udemy - I am a huge fan and will continue to purchase courses and support the community!

results.content:
The instructor is fine.
hence the 1 star but with all due respect, for 14$ one would expect 
more detailed explanations - all we did was to open a new visual-studio project and use the built-in template to create a standard project. 

The instructor ran the code, from that template, explained a bit and that's it.
You can probably get more from a free YouTube video. I joke you not.

Even though there's a 30 day money return, I take responsibility and stand behind my decisions, as poor as they may be, therefor I won't ask for a refund - but I can't say a I recommend this video series, to practically anyone who has some, even minor experience with visual studio.

I have NO idea why this ranked top on searching "Web Api" with so many reviews and top ranks. I really don't.

I'm sorry if this was harsh review, but I truly am disappointed from this course. Patrick, this course is OKish but priced way, waaay more than it's worth mate.

response.content:
Hi Stum, Thanks for your review. I'm really sorry to hear this course wasn't for you. I think the course simply doesn't suit your skill level - you did not need the information given by the lectures. Most of the students are really happy that I start from zero. This is also demonstrated by a lot of private messages I get, not only the reviews. And with all due respect, I do not only start a template and explain a bit. I guide you through the whole C# and JavaScript code necessary to run all CRUD operations with all HTTP request methods (POST, PUT, GET, DELETE), explain the differences between Web API 1 and 2 with their corresponding dis-/advantages and by the end I also push you into the right direction to build a database connection with Entity Framework. With the knowledge given by this course, you are ready to start your own web application with Web API 2 and jQuery - you get the whole package and can even ask me any questions (via private messages or the forums) which I always answer with my best conscience.
If you still don't think all these information are worth 14$, feel free to ask for a refund, really. That's why there is the 30 day money back guarantee.
Take care,
Patrick

results.content:
This course is interesting to understand the fundamentals of Web API 2,
but its lacking when it comes down to real world applications. It would have been interesting to see how to call Web API methods from a live host and how a web APIs could be also called manually or from different devices and networks.

results.content:
A good walk-through of creating a basic RESTful Web API service, with just the right level of explanation of how a web request gets to your C# code.  The focus is on the server side (C# & Web API) with just enough client code to demonstrate the server.

I found the delivery a little slow, perhaps because I have experience with C# and with web development in other languages; increasing the playback speed worked well for me.

results.content: Very good course for beginners to see how web api endpoints work.  I was using this as a refresher and would have liked to see more about the endpoint attributes and model attributes for data validation.  I feel that it would have fit very well into this course material since you introduced the concept of routing contraints.
